intro: Aconitum fischeri var. brachylobum, commonly known as the short-stalked monkshood, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its striking, hood-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant features palmately divided leaves and produces small, follicle-like fruits. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. Due to its toxic nature, it should be handled with care.
